abstract.p: Chuck Kushell is named chief executive at New York office of Focus One Media Group International; Michael R Riley is named to new post of president and chief executive of Krames; Donna Salvatore, president for US broadcast at MediaVest USA, is named chief executive, succeeding Kevin Malloy; Jerilyn B Dack is named to new post of executive vice president and director for integrated services at SFM/Media Planning (S)

block.p: * Chuck Kushell was named chief executive at a new New York office of Focus One Media Group International. He had been president of the New York office of Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies. * Michael R. Riley was named to the new post of president and chief executive of Krames, San Bruno, Calif., part of the StayWell unit of Havas MediMedia, a division of Havas Advertising. He had been president and chief executive of Facts and Comparisons, St. Louis, part of Wolters Kluwer.

He had been president and chief executive of Facts and Comparisons, St. Louis, part of Wolters Kluwer.

* Donna Salvatore, president for United States broadcast at MediaVest U.S.A., New York, part of the MediaVest Worldwide unit of the Starcom MediaVest Group, was named chief executive. She assumes duties that had been handled temporarily by Kevin Malloy, executive vice president for international operations at Starcom MediaVest, owned by the B Com3 Group. * Jerilyn B. Dack was named to the new post of executive vice president and director for integrated services at SFM/Media Planning, New York, part of the Media Planning Group division of Havas Advertising.
